items.title: Kusama Asset Hub Treasury - Testing the Payout to a Kreivo Community
items.content:
Following the spirit of [Proposal 382](https://kusama.subsquare.io/referenda/382) of testing the brand-new Treasury on Kusama Asset Hub, and since we've recently introduced controlling accounts via XCM, we'd like to make a small test:

We [transferred `1.1` KSM](https://kusama.subscan.io/extrinsic/0x08be5b237af6cc74a5b33eb5ee24221a503dab89c74c4e1a93f5973cd28e67d9) to the [remote treasury](https://assethub-kusama.subscan.io/xcm_message/kusama-fbeab4ac80c3904937011c53ca930c8d04e56c55) account on Asset Hub.

This proposal is expected to spend `1.1` KSM on `CuYrHbj4PNqVnpA17o8LDigdNXXYvEU7UaYW3kVyAdQskpE` (`../Parachain(2281)/Body(1)/Voice` on KAH) as the beneficiary.

Once the proposal is executed, we'll submit a referenda in Kreivo, from our [community governance](https://polkadot.js.org/apps/?rpc=wss%3A%2F%2Fkreivo.io%2F#/extrinsics/decode/0x4900470100000141011f0001010100a10f030c000400010000b28ce9061300010000b28ce90600060162f43e262538a40a0300d8dba69752ffb04fa563b126a31b037c8bebeb73e3c66cacd7c8efab46bd3423070010a5d4e80000000000). The outcome of that referenda is to send an XCM call to Asset Hub, to execute [`Balances::transfer_keep_alive`](https://polkadot.js.org/apps/?rpc=wss%3A%2F%2Fsys.ibp.network%2Fstatemine#/extrinsics/decode/0x0a0300d8dba69752ffb04fa563b126a31b037c8bebeb73e3c66cacd7c8efab46bd3423070010a5d4e8) to move `1` KSM back to the original sender (me).

We proposed this proof with two goals in mind:

1. Prove we can execute XCM Calls from our communities anywhere on Kusama Network.
2. Prove it's possible to make payouts to any XCM Location, not just accounts.

## FAQ

> **Q:** Have you ever tried if this works?
Yup, we made some tests using Chopsticks to ensure this is an acceptable behaviour given the current limitations of XCM on Kusama Asset Hub. What we found out is that we could use `Balances`, but no `PolkadotXcm` due to the `SafeCallFilter`, nor use something like `Proxy`. So, we're kinda limited, but we still want to try using this system with the limitations we have. That's how we designed the scope of this test proposal.

history.content:
Following the spirit of [Proposal 382](https://kusama.subsquare.io/referenda/382) of testing the brand-new Treasury on Kusama Asset Hub, and since we've recently introduced controlling accounts via XCM, we'd like to make a small test:

We [transferred `1.1` KSM](https://kusama.subscan.io/extrinsic/0x08be5b237af6cc74a5b33eb5ee24221a503dab89c74c4e1a93f5973cd28e67d9) to the [remote treasury](https://assethub-kusama.subscan.io/xcm_message/kusama-fbeab4ac80c3904937011c53ca930c8d04e56c55) account on Asset Hub.

This proposal is expected to spend `1.1` KSM on `CuYrHbj4PNqVnpA17o8LDigdNXXYvEU7UaYW3kVyAdQskpE` (`../Parachain(2281)/Body(1)/Voice` on KAH) as the beneficiary.

Once the proposal is executed, we'll submit a referenda in Kreivo, from our [community governance](https://polkadot.js.org/apps/?rpc=ws%3A%2F%2Fkreivo.io%2F#/extrinsics/decode/0x4900470100000141011f0001010100a10f030c000400010000b28ce9061300010000b28ce90600060162f43e262538a40a0300d8dba69752ffb04fa563b126a31b037c8bebeb73e3c66cacd7c8efab46bd3423070010a5d4e80000000000). The outcome of that referenda is to send an XCM call to Asset Hub, to execute [`Balances::transfer_keep_alive`](https://polkadot.js.org/apps/?rpc=wss%3A%2F%2Fsys.ibp.network%2Fstatemine#/extrinsics/decode/0x0a0300d8dba69752ffb04fa563b126a31b037c8bebeb73e3c66cacd7c8efab46bd3423070010a5d4e8) to move `1` KSM back to the original sender (me).

We proposed this proof with two goals in mind:

1. Prove we can execute XCM Calls from our communities anywhere on Kusama Network.
2. Prove it's possible to make payouts to any XCM Location, not just accounts.

## FAQ

> **Q:** Have you ever tried if this works?
Yup, we made some tests using Chopsticks to ensure this is an acceptable behaviour given the current limitations of XCM on Kusama Asset Hub. What we found out is that we could use `Balances`, but no `PolkadotXcm` due to the `SafeCallFilter`, nor use something like `Proxy`. So, we're kinda limited, but we still want to try using this system with the limitations we have. That's how we designed the scope of this test proposal.
history.title: Kusama Asset Hub Treasury - Testing the Payout to a Kreivo Community

history.content:
Following the spirit of [Proposal 382](https://kusama.subsquare.io/referenda/382) of testing the brand-new Treasury on Kusama Asset Hub, and since we've recently introduced controlling accounts via XCM, we'd like to make a small test:

We [transferred `1.1` KSM](https://kusama.subscan.io/extrinsic/0x08be5b237af6cc74a5b33eb5ee24221a503dab89c74c4e1a93f5973cd28e67d9) to the [remote treasury](https://assethub-kusama.subscan.io/xcm_message/kusama-fbeab4ac80c3904937011c53ca930c8d04e56c55) account on Asset Hub.

This call is expected to transfer `1.1` KSM to `CuYrHbj4PNqVnpA17o8LDigdNXXYvEU7UaYW3kVyAdQskpE` (`../Parachain(2281)/Body(1)/Voice` on KAH).

Once the call is completed, we'll submit a referenda in Kreivo, from our [community governance](https://polkadot.js.org/apps/?rpc=ws%3A%2F%2F127.0.0.1%3A8000#/extrinsics/decode/0x4900470100000141011f0001010100a10f030c000400010000b28ce9061300010000b28ce90600060162f43e262538a40a0300d8dba69752ffb04fa563b126a31b037c8bebeb73e3c66cacd7c8efab46bd3423070010a5d4e80000000000). The outcome of that referenda is to send an XCM call to Asset Hub, to execute [`Balances::transfer_keep_alive`](https://polkadot.js.org/apps/?rpc=wss%3A%2F%2Fsys.ibp.network%2Fstatemine#/extrinsics/decode/0x0a0300d8dba69752ffb04fa563b126a31b037c8bebeb73e3c66cacd7c8efab46bd3423070010a5d4e8) to move `1` KSM back to the original sender (me).

We proposed this proof with two goals in mind:

1. Prove we can execute XCM Calls from our communities anywhere on Kusama Network.
2. Prove it's possible to make payouts to any XCM Location, not just accounts.

## FAQ

> **Q:** Have you ever tried if this works?
Yup, we made some tests using Chopsticks to ensure this is an acceptable behaviour given the current limitations of XCM on Kusama Asset Hub. What we found out is that we could use `Balances`, but no `PolkadotXcm` due to the `SafeCallFilter`, nor use something like `Proxy`. So, we're kinda limited, but we still want to try using this system with the limitations we have. That's how we designed the scope of this test proposal.

items.content: Dear Kusama Community, I'm not sure how we didn't have a Kusama version of Flappy Bird until now, but we do now: https://kusama-fly-ksm.vercel.app. The requested tip amount is 1.989, which makes perfect sense considering that this is the year when Yayoi Kusama's artwork 'Bird' was created.

items.title: Tip for N4DRO for his forensic analysis of addresses associated with recent voting behavior
items.content: This tip is going to N4DRO for providing rapid analysis of addresses that were recently wildly swinging kusama referenda at the last moments with a goal to look to see if it's potentially nefarious in some way. He provided this information in the Chaos Dao discord while these events were on-going. The report: https://github.com/Nadro-J/GovSleuthing/blob/main/%23234%20%26%20243.md

items.title: Open Governance Test
items.content:
Dear community,

This referendum was opened to test another aspect of OpenGov.  I can't divulge the specifics at this point in time as it would introduce a bias.  I can however say that the outcome of the vote is inconsequential.  

Even with that said I would prefer a successful outcome to continue funding the account used by a public staking payout bot.

For those not familiar with my previous test please view the details [here](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/2151).

Have fun voting.

Regards,

items.title: Tip PolkaGate team for further testing of fast-unstake in Kusama
items.content:
I was informed by Kami from PolkaGate team that they have successfully [submitted the first fast-unstake process in Kusama](https://kusama.subscan.io/extrinsic/0x58baab6ce8d74e1be1743b57d68fad11dcc1eed9ef26b892003291e33dccea18). While this is great, I proposed to them to also test submitting multiple fast-unstake requests in parallel, so that we can test the [batching functionality](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/12394). Given the minimum nomination bond of 0.1 KSM, this requires a bit of initial funds, which I am suggesting to allocate to this team from the treasury. 

While most of these funds can be returned after the fact, I advocating for considering it a gift to the PolkaGate team, as they have consistently been the first wallet to implement latest staking features, and provider invaluable feedback to myself and the rest of the staking team.

items.title: To 0xTaylor for security related reports & community founding
items.content:
Dear community,

This referendum is two fold, it seeks to grant 0xTaylor a tip of 8 KSM but also tests OpenGov to see if it protects against spending more than the track allowance when using multiple transactions.  

0xTaylor is a popular actor within the ecosystem known for his input with security exploit related matters.  It is through his efforts that a blacklist was developed on Polkassembly, thus preventing users from applying usernames like `Admin` or `Administrator` which could otherwise be misleading.  He also reported `Hasura GQL endpoint` exploits to various teams that utilize the service, an example of which can be found [here](https://t.me/rmrkimpl/2717).  0xTaylor is also known for his input within the ChaosDAO and WagMedia communities members of which have endorsed his receipt of a tip.

On the note of security, I took this as an opportunity to test the coding of OpenGov with regards to multiple spends within a single batched transaction.  This proposal seeks to spend 16 KSM in two batches of 8 KSM. The first and 'guaranteed' execution being made to `0xTaylor`, in the unlikely event that there is a bug then another 8 KSM would be awarded to [an account](https://kusama.subscan.io/account/Gch4VxQ79WhjgQqHomvJbqF3Woza5g5cYgM8SVQdDb9szz1) for Public Kusama Staking Rewards Payout BOT.

If the second extrinsic executes then maximum spend per track would essentially be `Max spend` * `Number of transactions that can be fit within a batch`.  

Regards,

items.title: [Small Tipper] Guide for setting up an RPC node
items.content:
We propose a tip of 8 KSM (about 200 USD at the time of submission) for [Stakeworld's guide](https://stakeworld.io/docs/rpc) on how to set up RPC nodes for Polkadot and Kusama. Compared to running a validator, for which there is plenty of documentation, RPC nodes require more configuruation. In particular, the guide explains how to set up the SSL proxy and how to stress test the node.

Stakeworld also corrected and improved the official documentation on the [polkadot wiki](https://wiki.polkadot.network/docs/maintain-wss) to that end.

items.title: [Small Tipper] - Request tip for production of 2 videos
items.content:
Hello, I would like to request a tip of 6 KSM for the production of 2 Youtube videos containing Parachain news + 1.3 KSM as a refund for creating the wrong preimage in this proposal and losing that KSM: https://kusama.polkassembly.io/referenda/32

**Note:** The public address linked to this referendum has also been added to the description of both videos for transparency that it's really me who's requesting it.

1. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jR_iRg1kovE&feature=youtu.be

2. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hUBWRAsqS5U&feature=youtu.be

Thanks in advance.

Claudio (KryptosChain)

items.title: [Small Tipper] OpenGov referenda dashboard for 1kv validators - correct amount
items.content:
To put some order in the Chaos after the launch of OpenGov, derek of Metaspan has made a dashboard for checking votes and delegations of the 1kv validators. This is very useful since otherwise validators need to check their votes using cumbersome extrinsics or check one-by-one on Subsquare / Polkassembly.

The dashboard is accessible [here](https://metaspan.io/kusama/candidate) after you select a validator and go to the Referenda tab.

![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/MathCryptoDoc/dotsama-snippets/main/referenda/figures/metaspan_referenda-dash.png)

We propose a tip of 8 KSM (about 200 USD at the time of submission) for the current version of this dashboard.

**This referendum is a correction of Referendum 30 where the incorrect tip amount was configured**

items.title: [Small Tipper] OpenGov referenda dashboard for 1kv validators - wrong amount
items.content:
**Amount of the tip was entered incorrectly as the astronomically small amount of 0.000000000008 KSM. Please vote for referendum 31 instead!**

To put some order in the Chaos after the launch of OpenGov, derek of Metaspan has made a dashboard for checking votes and delegations of the 1kv validators. This is very useful since otherwise validators need to check their votes using cumbersome extrinsics or check one-by-one on Subsquare / Polkassembly.

The dashboard is accessible [here](https://metaspan.io/kusama/candidate) after you select a validator and go to the Referenda tab.

![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/MathCryptoDoc/dotsama-snippets/main/referenda/figures/metaspan_referenda-dash.png)

We propose a tip of 8 KSM (about 200 USD at the time of submission) for the current version of this dashboard.
